root.TEXT:
Record date: 2066-06-17
SDU JAR Admit Note
Name: Rivers, Ida
MR: 468 48 69
Date of Admission: 06/17/66
Cardiologist: Valdivia
CC: 73 yo woman with h/o Sjogren's syndrome, Diabetes (?Type I), vascular insufficiency who now presents with syncopal episode.
HPI: Ms Rivers was in her USOH until the morning of admission, when she went into the city to buy some buttons and pay a bill at ViewSonic. She noted that she was not feeling well throughout the morning, and she felt as if she may need to eat something. However, because she did not have her insulin and blood sugar monitoring equipment, she decided not to eat. She continued to feel poorly (she is somewhat vague on symptoms but reports feeling that her chest was congested and that she may have had some palpitations and felt chilled). She saw a police cruiser, and walked over to it with the intention of getting help. When she arrived, there was no one in the car, and she leaned forward to rest her head on the front of the car. This is the last thing she remembered; when she awoke, she was surrounded by people. She was told that she had falled backwards and hit the back of her head. When EMS found her, she was confused, making repetitive statements, and stating that she had pain in her occiput that radiated down her neck. When she arrived at the FMH ED, her blood pressure was 213/97 HR 84 RR20 O2 sat 99% RA Temp 97.3. She received Labetolol 20 iv, Toradol 30 mg iv, ASA 325 mg and Tylenol 1000 mg po x 1. Her mental status cleared somewhat, and her blood pressure came down to 130s/80s. She did have one episode of emesis, during which her HR was noted to transiently dip to the 40s (not captured on the monitor); spontaneously recovered to the 60s.
She had a C-spine series and head CT which were negative for acute process, and a CXR which was negative except for R shoulder not well-visualized on CXR. She was noted to have some superficial bleeding of her posterior scalp, but no obvious laceration. She was admitted to the SDU because of the episode of bradycardia.
PMH/PSH
-Diabetes Type I (by her report) followed at Hometown Medical
-Sjogren's disease, followed by Dr Vidal at RGH
-Pseudogout
-s/p benign breast mass resection 11 yrs ago.
-? Peripheral vascular disease?
Meds:
Insulin: Lantus 9-10 U qhs, Humalog sliding scale.
ASA prn
Colchicine prn
All:
PCN
SH:
Lives alone in Las Vegas with her cat. Her daughter lives in Cheboygan. Remote h/o smoking, no EtOH or drugs.
FH:
Unable to obtain
Exam: VS: BP 152/76 HR 77 O2 sat 99-100% RA
HEENT: posterior occiput with areas of oozing, no laceration or active bleeding, R pupil surgical, L reactive, nonicteric. EOMI. OP w/ dry mms, w/o exudates.
Neck: supple, NT, full ROM, no LAD, JVP at 8 cm
Lungs: CTA B
Cor: Regular nml S1S2, soft 2/6 SEM.
Abd: soft, non-tender, with BS
Extr: wwwp, no c/c, 2+ PP UE/LE, no edema. R shoulder minimally tender, ROM preserved.
Neuro: AAOX3, MS nl, CN II-XII grossly intact, Motor 5/5 UE/LE, Sensory gross intact. No nystagmus.
DATA:
Sodium (Stat Lab) 139 135-145 mmol/L
Potassium (Stat Lab) 3.9 3.4-4.8 mmol/L
Chloride (Stat Lab) 108 100-108 mmol/L
CO2 (Stat Lab) 25.5 23.0-31.9 mmol/L
BUN (Stat Lab) 17 8-25 mg/dl
Creatinine (Stat Lab) 0.8 0.6-1.5 mg/dl
Glucose (Stat Lab) 155 H 70-110 mg/dl
Calcium 10.6 H 8.5-10.5 mg/dl
Phosphorus 2.4 L 2.6-4.5 mg/dl
Magnesium 1.6 1.4-2.0 meq/L
Total Protein 8.1 6.0-8.3 g/dl
Albumin 3.7 3.3-5.0 g/dl
Globulin 4.4 H 2.6-4.1 g/dl
Direct Bilirubin 0.2 0-0.4 mg/dl
Total Bilirubin 0.5 0-1.0 mg/dl
Alkaline Phosphatase 125 H 30-100 U/L
Transaminase-SGPT 24 7-30 U/L
Amylase 58 3-100 units/L
Lipase 2.3 1.3-6.0 U/dl
Transaminase-SGOT 28 9-32 U/L
Creatine Kinase Isoenz NEGATIVE NEG
Troponin-I NEGATIVE NEG
WBC 5.2 4.5-11.0 th/cmm
HCT 39.5 36.0-46.0 %
HGB 12.1 12.0-16.0 gm/dl
RBC 5.44 H 4.00-5.20 mil/cmm
PLT 138 L 150-350 th/cumm
MCV 73 L 80-100 fl
MCH 22.2 L 26.0-34.0 pg/rbc
MCHC 30.5 L 31.0-37.0 g/dl
RDW 13.8 11.5-14.5 %
Superstat PT 11.9 11.1-13.1 sec
Superstat PT-INR 0.9
Result Text:
PT-INR values are valid only for WARFARIN ANTI-COAG THERAPY.
Superstat APTT 21.1 L 22.1-35.1 sec
DIFFERENTIAL REQUEST RECEIVED
Diff Method Manual
Poly 43 40-70 %
Bands 3 0-10 %
Lymphs 47 H 22-44 %
Monos 5 4-11 %
EOS 1 0-8 %
Basos 1 0-3 %
UA-Specific Gravity 1.010 1.001-1.035
UA-pH 7.0 5.0-9.0
UA-WBC Screen NEGATIVE NEG
UA-Nitrite NEGATIVE NEG
UA-Albumin NEGATIVE NEG
UA-Glucose 2+ NEG
UA-Ketones NEGATIVE NEG
UA-Occult Blood NEG
CXR:
IMPRESSION:
1. No active disease seen in the chest.
2. Mild degenerative change of the right acromioclavicular joint
is noted. Limited evaluation of the shoulder demonstrates no
other significant abnormality. Dedicated shoulder imaging is
recommended as clinically indicated.
C-spine films:
IMPRESSION:
NO EVIDENCE FOR CERVICAL SPINE FRACTURE OR DISLOCATION.
MULTILEVEL DEGENERATIVE CHANGES, MOST SEVERE AT C5-6 AND C6-7.
Head CT:
IMPRESSION:
No evidence of an acute intracranial process. Ventricular
dilatation that may be mildly out of proportion to sulcal
enlargement.
EKG:
NSR rate 74, J-point elevation V2
____________________________________________
Impression:
73 yo woman with h/o Sjogren's disease, ?Type I DM now admitted with syncopal event. DDx includes hypoglycemia, seizure (unlikely), vasovagal episode, arrythmia or ischemia.
Plan:
1.Cardiac
Ischemia: Continue ASA, B blocker as tolerated for elevated BP. Cycle enzymes, monitor EKG for new changes.
Pump: Echo today to assess function, r/o valvular disease or outflow obstruction.
Rhythm: In NSR, continue on monitor to assess for arrythmia.
2. Respiratory: ED CXR shows no significant pulmonary disease.
3. Endocrine: will continue her home Lantus and use CZI Regular. Will need to contact HMC re: her care. If she is Type I diabetic, will need basal insulin. No evidence of DKA on urine or labs. Check TSH, Hgbaic.
4. Rheum: h/o Sjogrens, extent of her disease unclear. Will contact her rheumatologist at RGH. Consider dedicated R shoulder xray once rules out to assess for possible fx, particularly if pain persists.
5. Neuro: imaging negative. She is slow in her responses; monitor closely for evolving neuro sx.
6. GU: Follow urine output.
7. ID: Afebrile. Normal WBC
8. Hem: HCT stable. Follow closely
9. F/E/N: replete magnesium, K prn.
10. Prophylaxis: nexium.
_________________________________
Rose Anaya, MD
Pager #76979

MEDICATION.text: Insulin: Lantus 9-10 U qhs, Humalog sliding scale.
B blocker as tolerated for elevated BP
Insulin: Lantus 9-10 U qhs, Humalog sliding scale.
